definitions.definition: to break a word at the end of a line according to the hyphenation rules by adding a hyphen on the end of the line.
to join words or syllables with a hyphen.
examples: you have to hyphenate his surname as it's double-barrelled

main_definition: ( transitive ) to break a word at the end of a line according to the hyphenation rules by adding a hyphen on the end of the line.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) to join words or syllables with a hyphen.
